remarks: If ` F ` is a section of ` G ` , then ` G ` is an epimorphism.  An epimorphism that arises from a section is also known as a _split epimorphism_.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)
statement:
sectepi.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
sectepi.e $e |- E = ( Epi ` C ) $.
sectepi.s $e |- S = ( Sect ` C ) $.
sectepi.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
sectepi.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
sectepi.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
sectepi.1 $e |- ( ph -> F ( X S Y ) G ) $.
sectepi $p |- ( ph -> G e. ( Y E X ) ) $.
